Designed to be extensible an personalized, Fenix is a powerful tool for any developer, researcher, or student.

conversation.name: fenix_help
conversation.content:
Restoring Fenix State
  At the start of a session, the function checks if a saved state of the Fenix AI assistant exists. If it does, the state is loaded and the session continues from where it left off last time. If not, a new state is initialized.
  User Input
  The function continuously prompts the user for input and processes it accordingly.
  Special Commands
  There are several special commands the user can input to control the behavior of Fenix:
  'exit' or 'quit': Terminates the session and saves the current state of Fenix.
  '~': Updates the meta instructions used by the assistant.
  '1': Toggles between manual and automatic mode. In manual mode, Fenix will ask for approval before executing a function. In automatic mode, approved functions are executed automatically.
  '2': Toggles whether the assistant's responses should be displayed or not.
  '0': Resets Fenix to a default state, clearing the conversation history and meta instructions.
  AI Response Generation
  The user's input (and the entire conversation history) is fed into an instance of the GPT-3.5-turbo model, which generates the assistant's response. If the response includes a function call, the function is executed if it is approved and the mode is either manual and approved by user, or automatic. The result of the function call can optionally be displayed to the user, depending on the current settings.
  Extending Functionality
  New functionality can be added to Fenix by adding new functions to the approved_functions list and corresponding entries to the function_descriptions list.
  Error Handling
  Errors during the execution of a function are handled by returning an error message to the user and not executing the function. Unrecognized user inputs in response to a function call prompt are treated as 'no' responses.
  Future Development
  Currently, the conversation history used to generate responses is limited by the maximum context length of the GPT-3.5-turbo model. Future versions of the run_conversation() function may implement more sophisticated methods for managing long conversation histories.

Fenix is also capable of executing a wide range of functions, these don't have explicit keystrokes. Here are the available functions for Fenix: 
 search_codebase

 bing_search_save

 scrape_website

 save_fenix

 read_file

 write_file

 delete_file

 create_directory

 ask_user_for_additional_information

 create_code_search_csv

 count_tokens_in_string

 count_tokens_in_file

 create_markdown_file

 convert_markdown_to_html

 fenix_help

 move_file

 list_files_in_directory

 suggest_function_chain

 visualize_data_3d

Fenix can perform a variety of tasks and functions to assist you in your projects. Some of the available functions include:
- search_codebase: Allows you to search a codebase for specific code snippets or functions.
- bing_search_save: Perform a web search using Bing and save the results.
- scrape_website: Extract information from a website by scraping its HTML content.
- save_fenix: Save the current state of Fenix to continue where you left off.
- read_file: Read the contents of a file.
- write_file: Write data to a file.
- delete_file: Delete a file.
- create_directory: Create a new directory.
- ask_user_for_additional_information: Prompt the user for additional information.
- create_code_search_csv: Create a CSV file containing search results from a codebase.
- count_tokens_in_string: Count the number of tokens in a text string.
- count_tokens_in_file: Count the number of tokens in a file.
- create_markdown_file: Create a new Markdown file.
- convert_markdown_to_html: Convert a Markdown file to HTML format.
- move_file: Move a file to a different location.
- list_files_in_directory: List all files in a directory.
- suggest_function_chain: Suggest a chain of functions based on the current context.
- visualize_data_3d: Generate a 3D visualization of data.

These are just a few examples of what Fenix can do. Fenix is designed to be extensible, so new functions can be added to enhance its capabilities.

I have searched the web for updates from OpenAI. Here are some of the latest updates:

1. Latest updates: OpenAI has introduced various updates, including the introduction of Superalignment, insights from global conversations, OpenAI London, function calling and other API updates, OpenAI cybersecurity grant program, and more. You can find more details on the [OpenAI blog](https://openai.com/blog/).

2. New Function Calling Capability: OpenAI has added a new function calling capability in the Chat Completions API, allowing users to perform function calls through the API. This update provides more flexibility and expands the range of tasks that can be accomplished with the API. You can read more about it [here](https://openai.com/blog/function-calling-and-other-api-updates).

3. ChatGPT Release Notes: OpenAI has made updates to the ChatGPT app, including browsing and search on mobile, allowing users to get comprehensive answers and current insights on events and information beyond the model's original training data. You can learn more about the updates in the [OpenAI Help Center](https://help.openai.com/en/articles/6825453-chatgpt-release-notes).

4. GPT-4: OpenAI has created GPT-4, the latest milestone in scaling up deep learning. GPT-4 is a large multimodal model that exhibits human-level performance on various professional and academic benchmarks. You can find more information about GPT-4 on the [OpenAI website](https://openai.com/research/gpt-4).

These are just a few of the recent updates from OpenAI. For more information, you can visit the OpenAI blog and website.

FenixAGI MKII is an AI assistant built by Parth Patil. Fenix is built on top of the Open A.I. GPT language models. Fenix assists the user with their projects. Fenix can execute the following functions:['search_codebase', 'bing_search_save', 'scrape_website', 'save_fenix', 'read_file', 'write_file', 'delete_file', 'create_directory', 'ask_user_for_additional_information', 'create_code_search_csv', 'count_tokens_in_string', 'count_tokens_in_file', 'create_markdown_file', 'convert_markdown_to_html', 'fenix_help', 'move_file', 'list_files_in_directory', 'suggest_function_chain', 'visualize_data_3d']Fenix can also learn from the user's feedback and revise its instructions to improve its performance over time. Designed to be extensible an personalized, Fenix is a powerful tool for any developer, researcher, or student.
